news.title: Karnataka: Bill proposing online registration of government-allotted land, mortgages passed
news.para: Karnataka Assembly passed a bill enabling online land registration for government-allotted properties and bank mortgages, using digital signatures to bypass manual processes. Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda highlighted the move aims to curb irregularities and automate loan closure updates.

news.title: Deadline set to clear demolition waste from roads & vacant plots in Gurugram
news.para: ULB Minister Vipul Goel has instructed MCG officials to remove three lakh metric tonnes of C&D waste within a month and resolve the stray cattle problem in 15 days. Rajesh Khullar emphasized keeping Gurgaon clean and directed officials to address garbage and waterlogging issues, while the MCG is working on waste management and sewage solutions.

news.title: Zaheerabad smart city infrastructure works to begin soon
news.para: Zaheerabad Industrial Smart City (ZISC) is poised to begin infrastructure works in the coming months, aiming to attract significant investments and generate numerous jobs. The project, part of the Hyderabad-Nagpur Industrial Corridor, has received necessary approvals and is being developed in phases, with Phase I spanning 3,245 acres.

news.title: Panels set up in April, but survey held up as Haryana yet to define ‘forest’
news.para: Haryana is yet to define 'forest' despite a Supreme Court order. This delay has stalled surveys and mapping of forest areas. Expert committees were formed in April but cannot begin work without the definition. Activists allege the government is deliberately avoiding protecting the Aravalis. The Supreme Court will hear the case on September 9.

news.title: KIADB under fire for move to divert Hebbal transit hub land to private developer
news.para: Karnataka Industrial Area Development Board faces criticism. It transferred land in Hebbal to a private developer. The land was for a Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited project. This decision reduces space for a transport hub. People accuse the government of favoring real estate.

news.title: Developers write to Gujarat government for uniformity in registration fee
news.para: Ahmedabad's redevelopment sector faces hurdles due to inconsistent registration processes. Developers are burdened by varying registration fees, with some offices charging 1% of the agreement value instead of a flat fee. The association urges the government to standardize the process, ensuring clarity on stamp duty and registration fees to facilitate smoother project execution.

news.title: Gurugram: Vacant for 15 years, 1,000 affordable flats to be repaired & allotted
news.para: Gurugram's Sector 47 EWS flats will not be demolished. Haryana Shahari Vikas Pradhikaran will renovate the 1,088 flats. These flats were built in 2010 but never allotted. Advocate Abhay Jain filed a complaint. The Prime Minister's Office intervened. Renovation work is sanctioned with Rs 8 crore. Allotment will happen after the renovation. The original plan was to auction the land.

news.title: DDA to launch premium housing scheme by August-end
news.para: The Delhi Development Authority is set to launch its Premium Housing Scheme 2025 by the end of August, featuring around 250 flats and parking spaces across various Delhi localities through e-auctioning. This scheme includes HIG, MIG, and LIG flats with prices varying accordingly.

news.title: Vadodara: 19th century Indumati Palace to be flanked by upscale apartments
news.para: The 145-year-old Indumati Palace in Vadodara, owned by Pratapsinhrao Gaekwad, is set to be developed into a residential and commercial complex. Six 12-storey buildings will be constructed around the palace, which will be restored and converted into a clubhouse for residents.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body to auction seven plots worth ₹447 crore
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation is set to auction seven prime plots across Bodakdev, Ambli, Chandkheda, Gota, and Sola, targeting a combined base price of Rs 447 crore. The auction includes residential and commercial plots, with a Bodakdev residential plot priced highest at Rs 3.10 lakh per sq m.

news.title: Consider converting Noida to a metropolitan council: SC to Uttar Pradesh government
news.para: The Supreme Court has directed the Uttar Pradesh government to consider replacing the Noida Authority with a metropolitan council for improved governance, following a critical report by an SC-appointed SIT. The SIT revealed centralized decision-making, favoring builders, and lack of transparency.

news.title: Over 500 Worli BDD chawl tenants in Mumbai to get flats in highrises
news.para: After decades of anticipation, 556 families from Worli's BDD chawls are set to receive keys to their new 500-sq ft flats, marking a significant milestone in the area's redevelopment project. The initiative, costing over Rs 17,000 crore, aims to improve living conditions for 15,593 residents, moving them from cramped 160 sq ft homes to modern apartments with enhanced amenities.

news.title: Lucknow: LDA to take over development of South City after terminating Unitech pact
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority has terminated its 37-year agreement with Unitech Builders for the South City project due to unfulfilled obligations and insolvency. The LDA will now assume responsibility for completing pending civic work, including roads, drains, and parks, using funds from remaining Unitech properties.

news.title: CBI court reject plea seeking clean chit for Chintal Group's CEO
news.para: A special CBI court in Panchkula has denied Chintal Group CEO D Vasudevan's plea to drop charges against him related to a building collapse. The court stated that Vasudevan's role extended beyond mere administration. The incident, which occurred in February 2022, led to two deaths and revealed faulty construction practices.

news.title: ED arrests Vasai-Virar ex-civic chief in money laundering case linked to illegal buildings
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested former Vasai-Virar Municipal Commissioner Anil Pawar and three others, including two builders, in connection with a money laundering case. The case is linked to the construction of 41 illegal buildings in Vasai-Virar, which were later demolished. Pawar's role surfaced during investigations into the illegal construction on land reserved for public utilities.

news.title: Brigade Enterprises' profit rises 79% to ₹150 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Brigade Enterprises announced a significant rise in its consolidated net profit. The realty firm's profit surged to Rs 149.88 crore for the quarter ending in June. This represents a 79 percent increase compared to the previous year. Total income also increased to Rs 1,332.86 crore.

news.title: Kalpataru posts ₹49.42 crore net loss in Q1 FY26
news.para: Kalpataru Limited, a leading real estate developer, faced a setback in the first quarter. The company reported a consolidated net loss of Rs 49.42 crore. This is a significant drop compared to the previous year's net loss of Rs 0.69 crore. The total income also decreased to Rs 456.78 crore. The figures are for the April-June period of 2025-26.

news.title: Pay pending property tax without interest in Ludhiana, penalty by August 15
news.para: Ludhiana residents have until August 15th to file over 1.92 lakh pending property tax returns from 2013-14 under the OTS scheme. Mayor Inderjit Kaur and MC Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal urge residents to take advantage of this opportunity to settle dues without penalties or interest. The extension aims to facilitate residents in clearing their outstanding property taxes.

news.title: Greater Noida: GNIDA grants partial OCs for builders who have cleared 25% dues
news.para: GNIDA has approved partial occupancy certificates for stalled housing projects under UP's rehabilitation policy, benefiting developers who have paid a portion of their dues. This decision aims to expedite possession for homebuyers in Greater Noida, which has a high number of stalled projects.
